attributes.action: Arthritis/Anklyosing Spondylitis to be added to the NHS medical exempt list.
attributes.background: Anklyosing Spondylitis is an auto-immune disease effecting more than 200,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication... Taking 20 tablets+ daily and not having free prescriptions.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for Anklyosing Spondylitis and Arthritis sufferers to be given free prescriptions and both conditions to be added to the NHS medical exempt list. This condition can affect any of us, and is usually diagnosed in your twenties. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription pre-payments till you're sixty is not fair, and it needs to be added to the medical condition exempt form.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Emily's Law' to ensure health and safety on privately-owned boats
attributes.background: 15 year old Emily Gardner from Gloucestershire died when her friend's boat capsized at sea. A catalogue of errors led to her death including the fact she was wearing a damaged and ill-fitting buoyancy aid. No laws currently exist to ensure that health and safety is observed on leisure craft.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tearful-mum-watches-schoolgirls-lifeless-8088025

https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/media/5614f0fce5274a6251000003/MAIBInvReport21_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Stop disabled parking space abuse in the UK, regardless of location or ownership
attributes.background: Many with disabilities struggle just getting in & out of a parked car, disabled bays are essential. It should be illegal for any non blue badge holder to park their car in a space reserved for those with disabilities. Without this 'The Equality Act 2010' is no longer effective.
attributes.additional_details:
Abuse of disabled parking bays is *rife all over the UK. Vehicles, skips, storage, smoking areas, temporary buildings, cancer screening/blood donor vehicles, temporary displays and more appear all too often in these bays, stopping those who NEED them from using them. Emergency Service Vehicles should ALSO have their own separate parking bay(s) to stop abuse of the disabled parking facilities - a disabled person cannot undo their disability. 

*Ref: www.facebook.com/wantmyspacetakemydisability

attributes.action: Negotiate the possiblity of British citizens opting to keep their EU citizenship
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to pursue the creation of an EU national status or to ensure the status of EU citizenship for British nationals, who desire such status, during the period of negotiation following the triggering of Lisbon: Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
48% of voters in the EU referendum chose to remain and a prominently cited reason was for access to freedom of movement and the ability to travel - made possible only because we are EU citizens. 

Currently many UK nationals enjoy dual-nationality with many other European countries, usually because they have ties with or have lived in a country for a number of years. Since we all have ties to the EU and have lived there for many years we should be eligible for an EU dual-nationality status.

attributes.action: Recognise the UK standard of firearm deactivation as equivalent to EU standards.
attributes.background: Proposed legislation in the Policing and Crime Bill intends to enforce the application of a EU standard that will result in firearms previously deactivated to UK Home Office standards being classified as defectively deactivated.  The EU standard is inferior to the UK standard and unnecessary here.
attributes.additional_details: The UK standard of deactivation is acknowledged as the best in Europe, and makes it impossible to re-activate a firearm without completely rebuilding the weapon. Imposition of the EU standard in the UK is a complete waste of taxpayers money, is disrupting a process previously recognised by government as effective in taking live firearms out of circulation, and penalises owners by making it illegal to sell or transfer safe UK deactivated firearms that will be unfairly classified as ‘defective’.

attributes.action: Maintain Pension increases for British pensioners living in the EU.
attributes.background: Depending on what treaties are agreed for Britain's exit from the EU, some British pensioners living in the EU may lose their annual State pension increases. We call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to commit to maintaining these increases for all British pensioners living in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Annual State Pension for British pensioners living overseas are only paid in 16 countries outside of the EU and Britain has not signed any new treaties for this since 1981.  When Britain exits the EU, the mechanism that allows pension increases to be paid there will also cease.  For this reason, we call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to ensure that when the UK leaves the EU, appropriate provision is made with the European Union to allow the payment of these increases.

attributes.action: Make breastfeeding education an integrated part of PSHE curriculum in schools
attributes.background: Early education on breastfeeding  can improve the general health of society, reducing the risks of obesity, infection, cancer, osteoporosis and postnatal depression rates, by increasing the likeliness of successful breastfeeding for mothers in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.unicef.org.uk/Media-centre/Press-releases-archive/Breastfeeding-could-save-the-NHS-millions-says-new-report/


http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/breastfeeding-linked-to-lower-risk-of-postnatal-depression

attributes.action: Make UK political advertising subject to the Advertising Code.
attributes.background: Political campaigning is a form of advertising, and like all other forms of advertising, it should be regulated. The recent referendum campaign highlights the urgent need for political advertising to become subject to the Advertising Code in the same way as other areas of advertising and marketing.
attributes.additional_details:
The Advertising Standards Authority ensures all adverts in the UK are "legal, decent, honest and truthful", and has the power to ban false advertising. However, their powers do not currently extend to political campaigning, meaning we have more protection when buying a toaster than voting in a referendum. 

An extension of the ASA's powers would strengthen our democratic system and protect free speech. Let's remove lies from our political discourse, and kick "post-truth politics" out of Britain.

attributes.action: We call upon Parliament to repeal The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act immediately.
attributes.background:
A current petition to Call a snap General Election elicited the response « The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act means no Government can call a snap general election.... » from the government.

M.P.s make laws ; and can repeal them.

attributes.action: Consider taking EDM660 forward into law
attributes.background: Early Day Motion 660 "LEGAL RECOGNITION FOR PEOPLE WHO DO NOT ASSOCIATE WITH A PARTICULAR GENDER" proposes allowing UK citizens who do not identify as male or female to use the X marker in place of M or F on passports in accordance with existing aviation treaties.
attributes.additional_details: There are many individuals in the UK and around the world who do not identify as male or female. Bodies are typically male or female, though some cannot be placed in either category through natural variation, and we find the same holds true of minds. The use of the X marker would have no significant impact on bureaucracy and yet would allow those who fall through the gaps of the current system to be represented honestly in their documentation in a way that is accurate to their lived experience.

attributes.action: Reinstate funding for Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy (SDR) on the NHS
attributes.background:
SDR is a neurosurgical procedure aimed at reducing spasticity (tight and stiff muscle tone) in the lower limbs
The surgery aims to:
Achieve a long-term reduction in spasticity
Improve function and mobility
Increase independence 
Increase range of motion and improve positioning.
attributes.additional_details: Reduction in spasticity is immediately apparent after the procedure, but SDR unmasks any weakness and difficulties with co-ordinating movements. Through the physio programme, children will learn to use their body in a new way. There's now enough evidence to demonstrate that SDR is associated with substantial long-term benefits. These not only relate to reduction in spasticity, but also relate to improved movement, walking and an improved quality of life for both the children and their families.

attributes.action: Make Breastfeeding awareness & social attitudes part of the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
The UK has the lowest breast feeding rate in the world, with only 17% successfully breastfeeding for up to 3 months, falling to around 1% after 6 months. 
We want future Mothers to feel there is no social stigma for either breast or bottle feeding, & that they have a choice.
#milknotguilt
attributes.additional_details:
Unicef have started a Call to Action on Breast Feeding in the UK. Details here: http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/News-and-Research/News/call-to-action/

See breast Feeding rates & figures for the UK here: http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/About-Baby-Friendly/Breastfeeding-in-the-UK/UK-Breastfeeding-rates/

NHS information r.e Breast Feeding: http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/pregnancy-and-baby/Pages/benefits-breastfeeding.aspx

Campaign hashtag #milknotguilt

attributes.action: Decriminalise None Payment Of The BBC's Television Licence (TV Licence)
attributes.background: The BBC are backed by the UK Government to criminalise non payers of the TV licence. It currently costs £145 a year for a colour licence. The people of the UK shouldn't be forced into paying a company that sort of money. Let's call on the government to decriminalise non payment of the TV licence!
attributes.additional_details: We are in the age of cuts, cuts & more cuts and the citizens of the UK simply do not have £145 available. The BBC have already scrapped BBC THREE and now we are getting even less for our money. So help us help you by signing this petition to decriminalise nonpayment of the BBC's TV licence. ABOLISH THE TV LICENCE TAX!

attributes.action: Prevent the new HS2 proposed line passing through Bramley, Rotherham
attributes.background: HS2 are proposing a new route for the line to pass through the village of Bramley. This means it will be dangerously close to local housing and other ameneties which raises a number of concerns including:- safety of local children, noise polution, negative impact on house prices, to name (but) a few

attributes.action: People with Irlen syndrome and dyslexia to get coloured lenses free on the NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a postcode lottery determines the cost of vital lenses which make a crucial difference to learning, vision and concentration. Some low income families are paying in excess of £200 for a pair of child's glasses which should be free.

attributes.action: Reopen all children's centres.
attributes.background: Children’s centres serve the most deprived areas and have high levels of usage. Children attending such centres show a good level of development at EYFS, and parents show a significant improvement in parenting skills and confidence. Financial cuts are forcing many children's centres to close.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/485346/DFE-RR495_Evaluation_of_children_s_centres_in_England__the_impact_of_children_s_centres.pdf

attributes.action: Pass the Cannabis (Legalisation and Regulation) Bill
attributes.background: A Bill to amend the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 to provide for the lawful production, packaging, marketing, sale, purchase, possession and consumption of herbal cannabis in specific circumstances by certain persons; and for connected purposes.

attributes.action: Help Save Children with Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Children with Neuroblastoma face many months of intense treatment but the chances of relapse are high. There is treatment in the USA that reduces this risk but that has to be funded privately.
The amount of money that is needed to pay for this runs in to hundreds of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of recent cases in the media where families of children with this cancer were trying to raise £550,000 to get this treatment in America. If the treatment is available to reduce the risk we should be providing that treatment here in the UK.

attributes.action: Provide All Children Under 16 With A Constant Glucose Monitor/Dexcom.
attributes.background:
Type One Diabetes, is a stressful, complicated disease. It is caused by the bodies immune system attacking itself, people have this disease through no fault of their own.
4 or more injections are needed daily in order for type ones to survive. As well as constant blood tests.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is diagnosed, it is extremely difficult for a caregiver or parent to manage their Diabeties, due to them not knowing what their blood sugar levels are and will have to do more blood tests on that child than normal. A Constant Glucose Monitor, such as the Dexcom would make the child's quality of life so much better. A parent can also have some more reassurance that their child is not suffering from hypoglycaemia or hyperglycaemia. 
Type one diabetes can kill. We need this!

attributes.action: First aid and CPR should be taught as a mandatory part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: People in the UK are unwilling to perform first aid - especially CPR - when required. If children were taught it at school, not only would this help those people injured in accidents or taken ill, it would also ease pressure on the already overstretched ambulance services and A&E departments.

attributes.action: Stop the building of large housing estates nationwide on green belt land.
attributes.background:
The government has pushed local councils to open restrictions on developing green belt land for large estates to be built.
This ignores brown field sites and housing that can be redeveloped.
I support the brown field development.
attributes.additional_details:
The original name given to the project in Sefton Council was The Core Strategy.
All the residents that knew about it raised objections that have not been addressed.
The plans have now been given the go ahead after a huge amount of money has been used for our supposedly cash strapped council to implement.
There reasons for the housing do not stand up to scrutiny. 
There is no infrastructure in place to accommodate the large estates. 
The dessicration of green belt land is therefore not required.

attributes.action: Call on Andrea Leadsom to NOT hold a vote to repeal the Hunting Act 2004.
attributes.background:
Andrea Leadsom has pledged to hold a vote to repeal the ban. The Hunting Act outlaws the hunting of foxes, deer, hare and mink with dogs.

Hunting wild animals with dogs and letting them get ripped apart for ‘entertainment’ is cruel and inhumane, and has no place in our civilized society.
attributes.additional_details:
Animals suffer physiological and psychological stress when chased by a hunt, whether they are killed or not. This was established as fact back in 2000 by a parliamentary inquiry (Burns et al., 2000), which led to the ban. 

The below references have proof and further info:

Burns, L. et al. (2000) Report of the committee of inquiry into hunting with dogs in England and Wales. The Stationery Office, London.

https://www.league.org.uk/~/media/Files/LACS/Publications/A-case-against-A4-report.pdf

attributes.action: The UK must put a complete Ban on  Child Immigrants from anywhere in the world
attributes.background:
The United Kingdom is no longer in a position to accept all and sundry.We have enough problems with poor educational levels and a lack of housing and jobs for the indigenous populations of England,Scotland,Wales and northern Ireland.

We must insist that the European union use the existing rules.

attributes.action: Make it against the law to withhold a defibrillator.
attributes.background: We recently heard of a leisure centre withholding a defibrillator to a nearby school where a teacher was in cardiac arrest thankfully the said lady has survived but next the person may not be so lucky make it law that if you withhold a defibrillator you will be held accountable
attributes.additional_details: The said leisure centre said they withheld the defibrillator as part of health and safety guidelines this is crazy health and safety would rather have a death on their hands

attributes.action: Government to confirm that the June EU referendum was non-binding and advisory.
attributes.background: The government needs to publicly confirm that the referendum was merely advisory. All that is being said is that 'the people have spoken' when well over half of the electorate did not vote to leave. The govt should not assume that those who did not vote at all are not happy with the status quo.

attributes.action: Stop Employment Agencies advertising jobs that don't exist.
attributes.background:
Recently I applied for two different jobs with agencies after spending over 2 hours filling out paperwork and talking to them about the job I went home expecting a phone call that I got promised. Two weeks later the job is still being advertised.
This has happened on many occasions.It has to STOP
attributes.additional_details: Employment agency's are falsely advertising jobs that don't exist.

attributes.action: United Kingdom to not leave the EU
attributes.background:
We the undersigned wish to not leave the EU on the grounds that a four point difference in opinion is not sufficient enough to effect such a significant, life long change to our country.

Such a margin on a jury would not secure a verdict in a UK court of law, and should not secure a verdict here.
attributes.additional_details:
The results are possibly not legally binding, and can be taken as "advisory":

'An Electoral Commission spokesman said that the EU vote was an “advisory” referendum, as opposed to a “binary” referendum which has a fixed outcome.'
Source: http://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/681535/EU-referendum-result-what-happens-if-dead-heat-50-50-Brexit-remain-leave-vote-2016
Also: http://www.businessinsider.de/green-eu-referendum-not-legally-binding-brexit-2016-6?r=UK&IR=T

attributes.action: Make the abuse and neglect of older people a crime
attributes.background: The constant reports of abuse and neglect of older people has gone on for too long. We are calling for such cruelty to be an aggravated criminal offence with statutory minimum sentences. This covers physical and sexual assault, financial and psychological abuse, and neglect.
attributes.additional_details: Most abusers are never charged, or if they are, they receive suspended sentences or community service. There are aggravated offences for Hate Crime, recognising basic charges are not enough. We want the same for older people. Action on Elder Abuse is a UK-wide charity that aims to protect and prevent the abuse of vulnerable older people. It has a national freephone helpline open Monday to Friday: 9:00 and 17:00 on 080 8808 8141 for confidential support and information. www.elderabuse.org.uk

attributes.action: STOP the cruel treatment Foxhounds constantly receive
attributes.background: Petition is asking for the govt or another source to monitor the welfare of the hounds. It is estimated that around 4,000 hounds are clubbed to death or shot each year if found unsuitable or show weakness. Week old pups are killed if not strong enough. Unsuitable or old dogs should be re-homed.
attributes.additional_details: It is seen as normal to shoot & incinerate hounds when no longer productive & disposed of if they fail in any way. They are killed at half their life expectancy, Hounds are punished for chasing the wrong scent. As soon as they are born they are taught to be savage which is not their natural instinct & removed if not savage enough. Old dogs are replaced in a constant cycle & shot without remorse & burned. More hounds are bred than needed. Some hounds are killed when hunting. They deserve better.

attributes.action: Death certificates to be given to parents of babies from 16 weeks
attributes.background: Please help me to change the law on registering the death of a baby from 16 weeks of pregnancy. I gave birth to my baby boy at 20 weeks pregnant. He did not breathe so I could not register him, which is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: Women who give birth to children prior to 24 weeks of pregnancy are unable to register the death of their babies. This is not fair as they are still babies and the death certificate means a lot. This is very hard for women and thousands of women have been through this. Please help me get the law changed so babies can be registered when they die.

attributes.action: Review Death by drink driving sentence removing the option of a reduced sentence
attributes.background: People who commit driving offences relating to excess alcohol are given sentences that are reduced after admitting guilt. Individuals do not deserve this opportunity and should serve full term to deter others,highlight the severity of such crime and show judicial support to victims and the families.
attributes.additional_details: Our daughter lost her life due to a drunk driver 3 times over the limit. The sentence was 8 years but given the opportunity to plead guilty this was reduced to 5 years. He was subsequently released having served only 30 months. To any family experiencing such events this type of sentence is severely distressing and flawed. Such sentencing must be assessed and addressed. These individuals are released and free to continue there lifestyles whilst the families are left with the life sentence.

attributes.action: British farmers should legally have to be paid at least the cost of production.
attributes.background: Farming is one of the only industries in which businesses are paid less than the cost of production. Take the dairy industry for example; the cost of producing a pint of milk is between 25 - 33.5 pence per litre (1), yet the majority of British farmers are paid under 20 pence per litre (2
attributes.additional_details:
Continuing to use dairy as an example, since 2000, more than half of British dairy farms have closed down, reducing from over 28,000 to under 10,000 (3), and this trend shows no signs of slowing down. 'Nearly one in 10 dairy farms across England and Wales have closed in the last three years' (4).

But this doesn't just affect dairy farmers, there are forecasts that the income for many others are due to drop by the following amounts this year alone (5):
Cereals down 24%
General cropping down 17%
Pigs down 46%

(1) Published 26 May 2016
http://goo.gl/vXJmyX
(2) Published 2 July 2016
https://goo.gl/UW5ygo
(3) Published 21 February 2016
http://goo.gl/BqdbG1
(4) Published 12 July 2016
http://goo.gl/JGh2As
(5) Published 29 January 2016
http://goo.gl/6E73qN

attributes.action: Include 'PELVIC PAIN' in the UK university curriculum for ALL medical students
attributes.background: Over 1 million women (and men) in this country suffer from pelvic pain.  Many suffer chronic, debilitating pain. Most struggle to find good medical care as their GPs and consultants received no education about pelvic pain during training.  Please help us make it a part of all medical training.
attributes.additional_details: I am one of those many women who suffers from chronic pelvic pain and it has devastated my life.  Leeds university is the only university to include pelvic pain in their curriculum for nurses. Healthcare professionals who suffer from pelvic pain themselves admit that they received no formal training in pelvic pain in their medical education.  The Pelvic Pain Support Network is a charity that promotes education, research and assists pelvic pain patients. Please support www.pelvicpain.org.uk

attributes.action: Conduct independent review of recognition of Somaliland as independent country
attributes.background: We congratulate the people of Somaliland as they celebrate the 25th anniversary of reclaiming their independence; recognise the strong historical ties between Somaliland and UK; welcome the strong cooperation between UK Government and Somaliland through development aid, trade and security assistance

attributes.action: Maintain the statutory role of the Supervisor of Midwives
attributes.background: Changes in the law recommended by the Kings Fund mean the statutory requirement for midwives to have a supervisor will be removed. Supervisors of midwives safeguard women and babies by ensuring excellence in midwifery practice. This recommendation would remove a vital part of public protection.
attributes.additional_details:
Supervisors of Midwives (SoM) give guidance and support to both midwives and mums to ensure that the care offered is timely and appropriate; is given in the right place; by the right person and that it will benefit the woman, baby and their family. Every hospital has a team of SoMs who are on call 24/7 to directly support women and midwives.
At time when there is clear evidence of NHS trusts prioritising financial balance ahead of quality of care this change will erode safety in maternity units

attributes.action: Allow babies that die before birth to have a birth and death certificate
attributes.background: Babies that die due to late miscarriage (in the second trimester) or still birth are not given a birth or a death certificate. This must change as the baby still existed. The baby(babies in the case of multiples) did exist and having legal documentation would help with the grieving process.

attributes.action: Grants to retrain oil and gas ex employees made redundant from the north sea
attributes.background: A call for funds to be made available to retrain all ex oil and gas workers that have been affected by been made redundant through north sea cut backs and help to find future employment and to be given grants for courses to help gain employment  like the ssi steelworkers

attributes.action: Regulate Isle of Wight ferry prices
attributes.background: I personally want to travel to Portsmouth to see my daughter but i have to go via Southampton as i am priced out by Wightlink due to their excessive fees. The IOW residents especially need regulation to stop the companies from monopolising on the services they provide. This is one of many examples.
attributes.additional_details: Both Isle of Wight ferry companies (Red Funnel and Wightlink) are charging a lot of money to travel, especially when there is events on the Island.  This restricts people financially (especially residents as they have no choice in using these two companies) in travelling either from or to the isle of wight.  This is damaging businesses on the Island that rely on tourist trade which is in decline,  families are also restricted in seeing each other.

attributes.action: I want all vets to compulsory scan all pets , even if it just the first visit 😊
attributes.background: I have personally reunited a dog (scampi) after being missing for 5 years by chip checking him the owners had owned him for 2 years and he was a little girls best friend , if a vet had scanned this dog at some point it could have saved alot of heart break , sign compulsory chip checking for all vets

attributes.action: NHS trusts/deaneries should make adequate provision for post-night shift rest
attributes.background: A Doctors.net.uk survey showed 41% doctors have fallen asleep after a night shift.  This is most prevalent amongst pre-consultant grade doctors, who can change hospital every 3-4 months, resulting in a long commute and no access to public transport, making night shifts inherently dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
The need to change place of work so frequently is unique to doctors in training, and whilst other professions do have night shifts, the ensuing length of commute (average of 25 miles) increases the risk to doctors, with 29% knowing a colleague who died driving after a night shift.  Over half never have access to an on-call room with, or without a bed (52% and 57% respectively).  Only 27% had access to paid on-site accommodation.  
Source: Doctors.net.uk survey, July 2016, n=1,135

attributes.action: Allow British expats and British nationals overseas the right to a dedicated MP
attributes.background: Expats and Gibraltar have no representation in the House of Commons. They should be able to return an MP who is specifically elected to serve British nationals overseas and Gibraltar.
attributes.additional_details: Expats and Gibraltar should be able to be represented and have their rights defended as many policies affect British nationals overseas however their voice cannot be heard

attributes.action: UK Government Introduce Licensing for all Air Weapons and Protect our Cats
attributes.background: The Air Weapons and Licensing (Scotland) Act 2015 comes fully into effect on 31 December 2016.  The new law will require any person who possesses, purchases, uses or acquires an air weapon to have a certificate to hold them legally. We ask that the same be introduced in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: Research by Feline welfare charity Cats Protection found more cats are killed in air gun attacks than 20 years ago -  In 2016 46 per cent of air gun wounds proved fatal for cats compared to 11 per cent in 1996.The findings are particularly concerning, given a leading criminologist has warned that some people who shoot cats could go on to commit similar crimes against humans. We are calling for stricter regulation on the ownership of air guns, as we strongly believe this will help to protect cats and other members of our communities from attacks.

attributes.action: Department of Transport to look into the service run by Abellio Greater Anglia.
attributes.background: Today train services were severely disrupted by overhead power cable failures. Even though Network Rail maintain these, the rolling stock is beyond fit for purpose with passengers sweltering in carriages.

attributes.action: Include young workers aged 18-24 in the Government's National Living Wage
attributes.background:
The National Living Wage only applies to workers aged 25+, meaning those aged 18-21 can be paid 26% less for the same work and those aged 21-24 nearly 7% less.

It also goes against the UK electorate. A Survation poll in September 2015 shows 66% of voters believe the NLW should apply to under-25s.
attributes.additional_details:
The statistics that those aged 18-21 can be paid 26% less for the same work as over 25s and those aged 21-24 nearly 7% less are worked out by calculating the percentage difference between the NLW and current NMW pay levels. Current NMW levels: 18-21(£5.30ph) and 21-24 (£6.70ph)

Link to the poll by Survation: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/09/26/poll-under-25s-should-be-given-national-living-wage_n_8194992.html

attributes.action: New Autism training for teachers to be designed and led by Autistic people.
attributes.background: It's been recently announced that teachers will have to learn about how they can support their students with Autism. I think that the material and delivery should be designed by people on the Autistic Spectrum. To help give staff a greater insight into the way we think.

attributes.action: NHS England: Fund second stem cell transplants for patients with blood cancer
attributes.background: In July 2016, NHS England announced that it is no longer routinely funding second transplants for patients with blood cancers and disorders. The judgement comes despite a group of experts, including clinicians and patients, recommending second transplants are funded.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many people alive today who are able to lead fulfilling and active lives because they had a second transplant. The advice of the clinical community has been ignored, effectively handing most of these patients a death sentence.

Anthony Nolan shared the story of Emily, who needed a second transplant: ‘I want to know why the NHS thought my life wasn’t worth fighting for. This could save my life, there was still hope - why didn’t they feel it was necessary to try everything possible?'

attributes.action: Require proof of identity to be provided by all voters in the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: More examples have been found of blatant fraud at polling stations where people who have turned up to vote are turned away having been marked as "already voted".
attributes.additional_details: These days, providing proof of identity is normal almost everywhere. Requiring proof of identity at the polling station ought to be mandatory for everyone who wants to vote, but especially in the EU Referendum, as a further guard against the fraudulent practices now rife throughout the United Kingdom and widely expected to occur during the Brexit vote.

attributes.action: No sale or privatisation of the Land Registry.
attributes.background: Since 1862 the Land Registry has recorded the ownership of land and property in England and Wales and produces data on house prices and transactions that are used by the government to make policy decisions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government is, once again, against professional advice, taking the first steps which will lead to a sell-off or part privatisation of the Land Registry to apparently pay down debt as if it is running a household.

The Land Registry is a highly respected and trusted institution. It is profitable. Yet the Government believes it would be better value for money if it were privatised.

We ask the Government to reconsider these ill-founded plans and preserve the Land Registry in its current form.

attributes.action: Stop all subsidies to the fossil fuel industry and subsidise renewables instead
attributes.background: It is now scientific consensus that not only is climate change the greatest threat facing our society but that the human activity of burning fossil fuels is the primary cause. The government is using public funds to supplement this industry that is destroying our children's future. You need to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Reported evidence of 6Bn in government subsidies -http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-government-pays-6bn-a-year-in-subsidies-to-fossil-fuel-industry-a6730946.html

Scientific consensus - http://climate.nasa.gov/scientific-consensus

David Cameron's sense of desperate urgency in his speech to the Paris Conference in 2015 - https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/pm-speech-to-the-cop21-summit-in-paris

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to stop the massacre of Igbos
attributes.background: Since the beginning of the year, there has been a number of attacks by Fulani herds men, on indigenous Igbo population in the east of Nigeria. The most recent, being an attack on the Nimbo Community in Enugu during which over 50 people lost their lives, several injured and properties destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: Of all these attacks, the Federal Government of Nigeria has been silence.
